com.appiancorp.ps.automatedtest.fixture

Class BaseFixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • fit.Fixture
      • fitlibrary.FitLibraryFixture
        • fitlibrary.DoFixture
          • com.appiancorp.ps.automatedtest.fixture.BaseFixture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fitlibrary.dynamicVariable.VariableResolver, fitlibrary.traverse.DomainAdapter, fitlibrary.traverse.Evaluator, fitlibrary.traverse.RuntimeContextual, fitlibrary.traverse.workflow.DoEvaluator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PortalFixture, TempoFixture

    public class BaseFixture
extends fitlibrary.DoFixture
    This is the base class for Appian Fitnesse Fixture This class contains fixture commands which are generic to Appian tests
    Author:
    henry.chandra, michael.chirlin

    • Method Detail

      • setupSeleniumWebDriverWithBrowser

        public boolean setupSeleniumWebDriverWithBrowser(java.lang.String browser)
        Starts selenium browser

        FitNesse Example: | setup selenium web driver with | FIREFOX | browser |
        Parameters:
        browser - Browser to test with, currently only supports FIREFOX
        Returns:
        True once browser has completed setup

      • setAppianUrlTo

        public boolean setAppianUrlTo(java.lang.String url)
        Sets the default appian url.

        FitNesse Example: | set appian url to | APPIAN_URL |
        Parameters:
        url - Url for Appian site, e.g. https://forum.appian.com/suite
        Returns:
        True

      • setStartDatetime

        public boolean setStartDatetime()
        Sets the start datetime with which all of the relative dates and datetimes will be calculated.

        FitNesse Example: | set start datetime |
        Returns:
        True

      • setDataSourceNameTo

        @Deprecated
public boolean setDataSourceNameTo(java.lang.String dataSourceName)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the datasource name
        Parameters:
        dataSourceName - Name of the data source
        Returns:
        True

      • setDateFormatStringTo

        public boolean setDateFormatStringTo(java.lang.String df)
        Sets the date format string. This is useful so that test cases will work in different geographic regions that format date and time differently. This format string must match Appian, e.g. in Australia the date string is dd/MM/yyyy.

        FitNesse Example: | set date format string to | dd/MM/yyyy |
        Parameters:
        df - Date format string
        Returns:
        True

      • setTimeFormatStringTo

        public boolean setTimeFormatStringTo(java.lang.String tf)
        Sets the time format string. This is useful so that test cases will work in different geographic regions that format date and time differently. This format string must match Appian, e.g. in Australia the time string is HH:mm.

        FitNesse Example: | set date format string to | HH:mm |
        Parameters:
        tf - Time format string
        Returns:
        True

      • setTimeoutSecondsTo

        public boolean setTimeoutSecondsTo(java.lang.String ts)
        Sets the global timeout seconds that are used for each implicit wait.
        FitNesse Example: | set timeout seconds to | 10 |
        Parameters:
        ts - Timeout seconds
        Returns:
        True

      • setScreenshotPathTo

        public boolean setScreenshotPathTo(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the path on the automated test server where screenshots will be placed.
        FitNesse Example: | set screenshot path to | C:\AutomatedTesting\screenshots\ |
        Parameters:
        path - Path to save screen shots
        Returns:
        True

      • setTakeErrorScreenshotsTo

        public boolean setTakeErrorScreenshotsTo(java.lang.String bool)
        Set the flag to take screenshots on errors. If true, every error in an automated test will trigger a screenshot to be placed in setScreenshotPathTo(String).

        FitNesse Example: | set take error screenshots to | true |
        Parameters:
        bool - true or false
        Returns:
        True

      • open

        public boolean open(java.lang.String url)
        Navigate to a particular url.

        FitNesse Example: | open | https://forum.appian.com/suite |
        Parameters:
        url - Url to navigate to
        Returns:
        True, if no errors are thrown

      • takeScreenshot

        public boolean takeScreenshot(java.lang.String fileName)
        Take a screenshot and place it in the directory defined by: setScreenshotPathTo(String).

        FitNesse Example: | take screenshot |
        Parameters:
        fileName - File name for new screenshot
        Returns:
        True, if screenshot is taken

      • loginIntoWithUsernameAndPassword

        public boolean loginIntoWithUsernameAndPassword(java.lang.String url,
                                                java.lang.String userName,

        FitNesse Example: | login into | APPIAN_URL | with username | USERNAME | and password | PASSWORD |
        Parameters:
        url - Url of Appian site
        userName - Username
        password - Password
        Returns:
        True, if action completed successfully

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor(java.lang.String period)
        Waits for a particular period of time.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | wait for | 20 seconds |
        | wait for | 5 minutes |
        | wait for | 1 hour |
        Parameters:
        period - Period of time, e.g. 5 minutes, 1 hour, 10 seconds
        Returns:
        True, once period has been reached

      • waitForSeconds

        public boolean waitForSeconds(java.lang.String period)
        Waits for X seconds.

        FitNesse Example: | wait for | 5 | seconds|
        Parameters:
        period - Number of seconds to wait for
        Returns:
        True, once time period has elapsed

        FitNesse Example: | wait for working |
        Returns:

      • waitUntil

        public boolean waitUntil(java.lang.String datetime)
        Waits until a particular datetime

        FitNesse Examples:
        | wait until | 01/11/2016 12:31 PM | - Test will halt until that particular time
        Parameters:
        datetime - Datetime string must match setDateFormatStringTo(String) and setTimeFormatStringTo(String)
        Returns:
        True, when time is reached

      • refresh

        public boolean refresh()
        Refreshes page

        FitNesse Example: | refresh |
        Returns:
        True, always
